name: Advanced Seminar in History of Analytic Philosophy
description: This course examines Analytic Philosophy in the mid-20th century, concentrating on Wittgenstein, Ramsey, Carnap, and Quine. Special attention paid to the metaphysical foundations of logic, and the nature of linguistic meaning, including the relations between "truth-conditional" and "verificationist" theories.
prerequisites: 3.5 credits in Philosophy, including 1.0 credit (2 courses) at the C-level, one of which must be PHLC43H3.
